title: The Secret to Self-Control
summary: People with good self-control aren't more disciplined—they structure their lives to avoid temptation. Instead of relying on willpower, they remove the need for it by eliminating cues that trigger bad habits. Self-control is a short-term strategy; environment design is a long-term solution.
keyIdeas: Self-control is not about willpower—it's about environment design.
The most disciplined people avoid temptation rather than resist it.
Remove the cue, and the craving never appears.
Willpower is a finite resource that gets depleted.
Design your environment so the right thing is easy and the wrong thing is hard.
You can't be tempted by what you can't see.
The best form of self-control is not needing self-control.
examples: Unsubscribe from email lists to avoid impulse purchases.
Delete social media apps from your phone to reduce distraction.
Keep unhealthy snacks out of the house to avoid temptation.
exercises: Identify one temptation you can eliminate from your environment.
List 3 ways to make a bad habit harder to perform.
Remove one cue that triggers an unwanted behavior.
reflections: Where are you relying on willpower when you could redesign your environment?
What temptations could you eliminate to make good habits easier?
